text.title: Make a Carrot Clarinet
text.head: Make a Carrot Clarinet
text.p: Clarinets are a musical instrument from the woodwind family . The clarinet is classified by its cylindrical shape and the type of mouthpiece used to play it . Traditional clarinets are made from plastic or wood in a factory , but you can make one at home for fun , using just a carrot !
text.head: Steps

list.item:
Buy a large carrot . It should be quite large ( 190mm or longer ) .
This carrot should be sturdy and not soft .

Gather other supplies .
Get a clarinet or saxophone mouthpiece , reed , and ligature .
Get a kitchen knife , vegetable peeler , and funnel .
Get a tube that is 12mm in diameter cut to 35mm long and some electrical tape .
Get an electric drill with a 12mm spade bit and a 7mm drill bit .
Cut the ends of the carrot off . The length of the carrot should come to about 187mm .

Mark 6 holes on the front of the carrot .
The 1st hole should be 39mm from the top of the carrot .
The 2nd hole should be 54mm from the top of the carrot .
The 3rd hole should be 74mm from the top of the carrot .
The 4th hole should be 97mm from the top of the carrot .
The 5th hole should be 123mm from the top of the carrot .
The 6th hole should be 140mm from the top of the carrot .

Mark one hole on the back for your thumb .
The thumbhole should be 22mm from the top of the carrot .

Drill through the center of the carrot .
Use the 12mm spade bit and drill straight down the center of the carrot from top to bottom .
As you drill , dump the contents of the inside of the carrot into the bowl .
Drill until there is a clear path from one end of the carrot to the next .

Drill the 6 holes on the front of the carrot .
Use the 7mm drill bit to drill each of the marked 6 holes through to the center of the carrot .

Drill the 1 hole on the back of the carrot .
Use the 7mm drill bit to drill the 1 marked hole through to the center of the carrot .

Use a vegetable peeler to peel off a layer over the holes on the carrot .
This created a slightly flat part of the carrot that will home the finger and thumb holes for the clarinet .

Attach a 12mm tube to the bottom of the mouthpiece .
If the tube does not stay in the mouthpiece , wrap a piece of electrical tape around the end of the tube to widen the wall of the tube . ( Some mouthpieces will fit differently from others . )

Attach the 12mm tube and mouthpiece to the top of the carrot .
The opposite end of the tube should fit inside of the top of the carrot .

Add a funnel to the bottom of the carrot , if desired .
The funnel makes the carrot look more like a clarinet and amplify the sound a little bit .
The carrot is playable without the funnel .
